meanings.definition: A person who blurts out information without thinking.
meanings.sent1: The blurter in class always interrupts the teacher.
meanings.sent2: My little brother is a blurter; he can't keep a secret.
meanings.sent3: The blurter accidentally revealed the surprise party plans.
meanings.sent4: She was a blurter of secrets, unable to hold them in.
meanings.sent5: The blurter's loose lips sank many ships.

meanings.definition: To speak suddenly and without thinking.
meanings.sent1: Please don't blurter out the answer before everyone has a chance to think.
meanings.sent2: He tends to blurter when he gets nervous.
meanings.sent3: I blurtered out the wrong name by mistake.
meanings.sent4: The news blurtered out of her mouth before she could stop it.
meanings.sent5: The child blurtered out the family secret in front of everyone.
